content.text: HTML Input form* Attributes
This chapter describes the different form* attributes for the HTML <input> element.
content.html: This chapter describes the different form* attributes for the HTML <input> element.

content.text: The form Attribute
The input form attribute specifies the form the <input> element belongs to.
content.html: The input form attribute specifies the form the <input> element belongs to.

content.text: The value of this attribute must be equal to the id attribute of the <form> element it belongs to.
content.html: The value of this attribute must be equal to the id attribute of the <form> element it belongs to.

content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php" id="form1">
  <label for="fname">First name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname"><br><br>
  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
</form>

<label for="lname">Last name:</label>
<input type="text" id="lname" name="lname" form="form1">

content.text: The formaction Attribute
The input formaction attribute specifies the URL of the file that will process the input when the form is submitted.
content.html: The input formaction attribute specifies the URL of the file that will process the input when the form is submitted.

content.text: Note: This attribute overrides the action attribute of the <form> element.
content.html: Note: This attribute overrides the action attribute of the <form> element.

content.text: The formaction attribute works with the following input types: submit and image.
content.html: The formaction attribute works with the following input types: submit and image.

content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php">
  <label for="fname">First name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname"><br><br>
  <label for="lname">Last name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname"><br><br>
  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
  <input type="submit" formaction="/action_page2.php" value="Submit as Admin">
</form>

content.text: The formenctype Attribute
The input formenctype attribute specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitted (only for forms with method="post").
content.html: The input formenctype attribute specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitted (only for forms with method="post").

content.text: Note: This attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the <form> element.
content.html: Note: This attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the <form> element.

content.text: The formenctype attribute works with the following input types: submit and image.
content.html: The formenctype attribute works with the following input types: submit and image.

content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page_binary.asp" method="post">
  <label for="fname">First name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname"><br><br>
  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
  <input type="submit" formenctype="multipart/form-data"
  value="Submit as Multipart/form-data">
</form>

content.text: The formmethod Attribute
The input formmethod attribute defines the HTTP method for sending form-data to the action URL.
content.html: The input formmethod attribute defines the HTTP method for sending form-data to the action URL.

content.text: Note: This attribute overrides the method attribute of the <form> element.
content.html: Note: This attribute overrides the method attribute of the <form> element.

content.text: The formmethod attribute works with the following input types: submit and image.
content.html: The formmethod attribute works with the following input types: submit and image.

content.text: The form-data can be sent as URL variables (method="get") or as an HTTP post transaction (method="post").
content.html: The form-data can be sent as URL variables (method="get") or as an HTTP post transaction (method="post").

content.text: Notes on the "get" method:
content.html: Notes on the "get" method:

content.text: Notes on the "post" method:
content.html: Notes on the "post" method:

content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php" method="get">
  <label for="fname">First name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname"><br><br>
  <label for="lname">Last name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname"><br><br>
  <input type="submit" value="Submit using GET">
  <input type="submit" formmethod="post" value="Submit using POST">
</form>

content.text: The formtarget Attribute
The input formtarget attribute specifies a name or a keyword that indicates where to display the response that is received after submitting the form.
content.html: The input formtarget attribute specifies a name or a keyword that indicates where to display the response that is received after submitting the form.

content.text: Note: This attribute overrides the target attribute of the <form> element.
content.html: Note: This attribute overrides the target attribute of the <form> element.

content.text: The formtarget attribute works with the following input types: submit and image.
content.html: The formtarget attribute works with the following input types: submit and image.

syntaxHighlighting.text: <input type="submit" formtarget="_blank" value="Submit to a new window/tab">
type="submit" formtarget="_blank" value="Submit to a new window/tab"

syntax_highlighting.text: <input type="submit" formtarget="_blank" value="Submit to a new window/tab">
type="submit" formtarget="_blank" value="Submit to a new window/tab"

content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php">
  <label for="fname">First name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname"><br><br>
  <label for="lname">Last name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname"><br><br>
  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
  <input type="submit" formtarget="_blank" value="Submit to a new window/tab">
</form>

syntax_highlighting_data.text: <input type="submit" formtarget="_blank" value="Submit to a new window/tab">
type="submit" formtarget="_blank" value="Submit to a new window/tab"

content.text: The formnovalidate Attribute
The input formnovalidate attribute specifies that an <input> element should not be validated when submitted.
content.html: The input formnovalidate attribute specifies that an <input> element should not be validated when submitted.

content.text: Note: This attribute overrides the novalidate attribute of the <form> element.
content.html: Note: This attribute overrides the novalidate attribute of the <form> element.

content.text: The formnovalidate attribute works with the following input types: submit.
content.html: The formnovalidate attribute works with the following input types: submit.

content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php">
  <label for="email">Enter your email:</label>
  <input type="email" id="email" name="email"><br><br>
  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
  <input type="submit" formnovalidate="formnovalidate"
  value="Submit without validation">
</form>

content.text: The novalidate Attribute
The novalidate attribute is a <form> attribute.
content.html: The novalidate attribute is a <form> attribute.

content.text: When present, novalidate specifies that all of the form-data should not be validated when submitted.
content.html: When present, novalidate specifies that all of the form-data should not be validated when submitted.

content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php" novalidate>
  <label for="email">Enter your email:</label>
  <input type="email" id="email" name="email"><br><br>
  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
</form>

What is not a legal form attribute for the INPUT element?
content.html: What is not a legal form attribute for the INPUT element?

content.text: HTML Form and Input Elements

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<form> Defines an HTML form for user input
<input> Defines an input control

content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
